title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 78.50 - Vehicles repurchased pursuant to the lemon law
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 78.50 - Vehicles repurchased pursuant to the lemon law

State Regulations
(a) Upon the repurchase of a vehicle by its
manufacturer or a dealer, pursuant to section 198-a (new car lemon law) or
section 198-b (used car lemon law) of the General Business Law, or arbitration
or alternative dispute procedure, the manufacturer or dealer shall mail a
notice of such repurchase and the title to the vehicle to the New York State

Department of Motor Vehicles, Title Bureau, Empire State Plaza, Albany, NY
12228 within five business days after the repurchase. (b) The manufacturer or dealer must receive
the title or transferrable registration from the owner as part of the
repurchase of the vehicle. (c) Any
repurchase of a vehicle after an owner has filed, had accepted and paid all
fees required for arbitration shall be deemed a repurchase pursuant to General

Business Law, section 198-a or 198-b. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15

78.50

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
